alert.note: Alert for Sierra Madre Range; Snowy Range (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Cheyenne (Southeastern Wyoming and Western Nebraska)
info.headline: Wind Chill Warning issued December 21 at 1:45PM MST until December 23 at 11:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM MST THURSDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 5 AM THURSDAY TO 11 AM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Heavy mountain snow and blowing snow likely, along with extremely dangerous and life threatening wind chills. Total snowfall accumulations of 8 to 15 inches expected, along with wind gusts up to 65 MPH. Wind chills as low as 60 degrees below zero. * WHERE...Sierra Madre Range and Snowy Range. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 5 AM MST Thursday. For the Wind Chill Warning, from 5 AM Thursday to 11 AM MST Friday. * IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible mountain travel with icy, snow packed roads and near blizzard conditions in falling and blowing snow. Extreme wind chills can lead to frost bite and hypothermia in a matter of minutes. Outdoor recreation will be extremely dangerous and life threatening to those caught unprepared for severe winter conditions. Hikers and snowmobilers can easily become disoriented due to whiteout conditions and may become lost. Severe injury or loss of life is possible due to prolonged exposure to such conditions.
info.instruction: If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in your vehicle in case of an emergency. Avoid outside activities if possible. When outside, make sure you wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
